situation.title: The return home
situation.meta_description: The operation of accommodation on university dormitories is limited. Rules and recommendations to return home for students.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

The operation of accommodation on university dormitories is limited. Students who do not meet the special conditions (explained in more detail in the Halls of residenceÂ section) must return home to their place of residence.

If you are returning home to your family, take advantage of immediate testing on Covid-19 through mobile testing facilities. Please wait for the test result in isolation to prevent possible contact with the infected person and subsequent transmission to your loved ones.

In the case of a positive test result, we recommend spending your quarantine in the student dormitory area. We recommend the same procedure if you are already in quarantine. Finish your quarantine in the dormitory and then go home to your family.

In case of mental problems associated with isolation, fear of illness, or concern for loved ones, use the information from the Stress and handling the impacts of pandemic section.

After returning home, the student is perceived as a member of the household to which they returned. Therefore, follow the government's measures that apply to members of one household.
